meanings.definition: To seize control of an aircraft in flight by force.
meanings.sent1: The criminals skyjacked the plane and demanded a ransom.
meanings.sent2: The terrorists skyjacked the aircraft and diverted its course.
meanings.sent3: The birds skyjacked the plane for a joyride around the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The storm skyjacked the plane, tossing it around like a toy.
meanings.sent5: The pilot had nightmares about being skyjacked by aliens.

meanings.definition: The act of hijacking an aircraft in flight.
meanings.sent1: The skyjacked plane landed safely after the ordeal.
meanings.sent2: The authorities investigated the skyjacked aircraft incident.
meanings.sent3: The movie featured a comedic scene with a skyjacked plane full of clowns.
meanings.sent4: The skyjacked flight symbolized the chaos of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The news report detailed the daring skyjacked escape of the criminals.
